did.unittitle: Rocky Mountain College (formed by merger of Billings Polytechnic Institute and Intermountain Union College the successor to College of Montana and Montana Wesleyan College)
did.abstract: Located in Billings, Montana. Formed by the merger of Billings Polytechnic Institute (founded in 1908) and Intermountain Union College which grew out of the College of Montana (Presbyterian) and Montana Wesleyan College (Methodist ). The College of Montana was founded in 1878 as Montana Collegiate Institute in Deer Lodge, MT. In 1883 it was acquired by the Presbyterians and incorporated in 1884 as College of Montana. It closed in 1916. Montana Wesleyan College was founded in 1889 as Montana Wesleyan University in Helena, MT, changing its name around 1913. In 1923 the assets of both schools were combined to found Intermountain Union College. In 1935 an earthquake destroyed its buildings. The College completed the school year in Great Falls, and in 1936 moved to the campus of Billings Polytechnic Institute, merging in 1947 to become Rocky Mountain College.
